tweets.text:
Heavy showers can lead to surface water and river flooding in some communities. Here at #Didsbury, you can see how high water levels are. 

Check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn
 
#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/G3YpFLjgnu

tweets.text: @amy_flanagandy @derbyshiredales @PaulReevesEA @HighPeakBC @EnvAgencyMids Hello Amy, Maddie here from Sky News. Could we use your video with your credit? Thank you.

#StormChristoph has led to high river levels across the country. Stay safe at home ‚Äì if you do need to head out, don‚Äôt take any unnecessary risks. Check your flood risk before you leave: https://t.co/xNlgwQ9Q4z 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/NoJbBteLiZ

tweets.text:
A dairy farmer, stuck up to their axles in mud whilst out spreading slurry during #StormChristoph on bare #maize stubble adjacent to a ditch.

There's been a big increase in illegal farm activities since the Covid started. Penalties should follow suit. https://t.co/TzA4AuUA0G

tweets.text: Our first #WaterWednesday of #2021 is a chat with Dr Toby Willison, our new Director of Environment and Corporate Affairs, who‚Äôs joined us from @EnvAgency. Toby talks about his motivations and what he‚Äôs looking forward to achieving: https://t.co/V3JT3aRLFs

tweets.text:
@gmpolice @manchesterfire @EnvAgency @metoffice üìä Our last #COVID19 update shows the number of first vaccine doses carried out across GM as of today: approx. 195.771.

Andy thanks all NHS staff, volunteers, and everyone involved in the collective effort.

üó£Ô∏è "The level of progress really has kicked on again this week."

üëá https://t.co/jnUL4mlMP7
Some Derbyshire rainfall figures from @EnvAgency sites Ashbourne 37.5 and Brassington 38.8 in 48hrs

Flood warnings and alerts are in force across #Yorkshire today. Here‚Äôs the River #Wharfe at #Collingham near #Wetherby where an alert is in force, but also a warning for Collingham Beck. You can check your local river level here: https://t.co/Rk3f6g5XmU https://t.co/pXtmZuOnwX

tweets.text: We‚Äôre currently supporting our colleagues from @Go_CheshireWest, @CheshireFire and¬†@EnvAgencyNW, evacuating a number of residents from Hayhurst Marina due to the flooding cause by #StormChristoph. #StaySafe https://t.co/VqH0A1WD5h
@RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts It may seem insignificant but as the landscape gets built up more area is hard paved or roof and that is seldom adequately attenuated.

tweets.text:
There are a number of areas currently at highest risk of flooding:
Shepley Bridge
Hurst Lane
Queens Square
Low Mills
Bankfield Business Park, Mirfield
Holme Bank Mills/Gill Bridge

If you are in one of these areas please follow @EnvAgencyYNE for updates and take steps to prepare. https://t.co/LoSixkRs3y

We have 14 #flood warnings in place across Greater Manchester and Cheshire this afternoon. This means flooding is expected and immediate action is required

Check your risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/r0eYwgfghj https://t.co/JDTUFhoa1j
@RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts So it becomes easy to blame uplands where little has changed in my lifetime.  The issue is the addition or poor management of water with towns.

urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
There are a number of #flood alerts and flood warnings in place across the North West - check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn 

Our teams continue to monitor the situation and are ready to respond. https://t.co/u9TpFotMXF

The River Loxley at ‚ÄòRowell Bridge level recorder‚Äô a few minutes ago. Swollen, turbulent, angry and still rising. Fingers crossed for the folk downstream of all this! You can check the river level every 15 minutes via @EnvAgency site here: https://t.co/5yC1Z9nYMZ https://t.co/PiN8KzH8fd

@RobStoneman @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts Sorry I think I didn't make myself clear. I was on about road gullies.  Many haven't been cleaned for years so rain just dumps silt off the roads into watercourses and those drains are lost as an attenuation source.

Police on site at Jacksons Bridge and Environment Agency staff at #Flood gate ready to open it soon. Take real care on Hardy Lane, Maitland. It is being very closely monitored. @ChorltonPkLab @MCCChorlton @GMPChorlton https://t.co/WK4Ro464nr

urls.title: Update following the arrival of Storm Christoph
urls.description: In order to be as prepared as possible and provide a co-ordinated response a major incident has been declared following the arrival of Storm Christoph.

tweets.text: @Go_CheshireWest @CheshireFire @EnvAgencyNW Visit our website for more information: https://t.co/rxCkichld4
@PoliceNorthwich @Go_CheshireWest @CheshireFire @EnvAgencyNW Am I being daft - or are they... on boats?

IMPORTANT MESSAGE: 
Serious & widespread #flooding is expected over the coming days as a result of #StormChristoph's heavy & prolonged rainfall.

58 #FloodWarnings are already in force, & sadly more are expected across much of northern & central #England over the next 24 hours. https://t.co/1nCQasnN8y

Just attended @ManCityCouncil Executive for an urgent item on flooding in #Didsbury ‚Äì  thank you @gmpolice @manchesterfire @EnvAgency for tireless work through the night ‚Äì road closures will be rolling to maintain safety - Palatine Road to be added shortly https://t.co/NHzFKanokC
@scallmcfc @EnvAgencyNW @MENnewsdesk Thanks for tagging @MENnewsdesk - please could we use this video within our coverage of the weather today? Will give you full credit. Thank you
@derbyshiredales @PaulReevesEA @HighPeakBC @EnvAgencyMids Current river status at Litton Mill. https://t.co/O2hprEu2s7

We currently have 17 #flood warnings and 40 #flood alerts in place across the #Yorkshire region.  For the latest details about the areas affected by #StormChristoph please visit the live national flood warning map at https://t.co/tumDuoEmi2 #PrepareActSurvive #SafetyFirst https://t.co/SKf9a3ZAzl
@EnvAgencyNW @MENnewsdesk River Mersey in Heaton Mersey near Vale Road. Looks about ready to go onto the road üòï https://t.co/qAq3sli11C

It‚Äôs wet, wet, wet across the #Midlands today (Wednesday). Lots of surface water on roads. Please don‚Äôt drive through #flood water. 30cms is enough to float your car. Keep checking your #flood risk. Latest update here 
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/fMneKq3b7w
@JoshFG @EnvAgencyYNE @slowtheflow_UK @Calderdale Hi Josh, please can we broadcast this on the Local TV network with a credit to you?
Fast flowing and rising River #Wharfe at Burley in #Wharfedale. @itvcalendar  @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/uzNiUxRhLe

20 Jan 2021 @1400 There are now 11 #FloodAlerts in the South East due to #StormChristoph. Only a third of people who live in areas at risk of flooding believe their property is at risk. Check your risk at https://t.co/vkHcHO9ADQ  #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/svWmwlEE65

tweets.text: We know it will happen, yet we still manage the hills to give them the water absorption capacity of tarmac. Stop burning & stop over-grazing to ensure our hills can absorb these storms. Sandbags are not the answer. @EnvAgency @YWDirectors @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/d5JSR8Ja5N

#StormChristoph is continuing to bring heavy rain across England which can lead to #flooding. Check your flood risk and sign up for flood warnings: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY  

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/O3zNENsUPo
Four flood warnings are still in place for Lincolnshire - here's an update from @EnvAgency. https://t.co/8Vj0bouGjR

This is the River Roch in #Rochdale üò±. The @EnvAgencyNW has issued a red warning here meaning flooding is expected and immediate action is required. All news on #flooding in Greater Manchester on @BBCRadioManc #StormCristoph https://t.co/niFcRqsrPv

@gmpolice @manchesterfire @EnvAgency @metoffice Residents in affected areas are being contacted by local authorities to advise them of the current situation.

tweets.text:
@gmpolice @manchesterfire @EnvAgency @metoffice ‚ö†Ô∏è If you need to evacuate your home due to flooding and stay with family or friends temporarily you will not be in breach of #COVID19 laws, which allow for exceptions including to escape risk of harm

You should still take all precautions to minimise risk to yourself and others https://t.co/32RqRP49gU

@gmpolice @manchesterfire @EnvAgency @metoffice üó£Ô∏è @gmpolice ACC Nick Bailey: ‚ÄúThe @metoffice are still stating that we are going to have significant rainfall, and that is still going to cause flooding, drains being full, roads being blocked." 

"Fields and other areas will flood just because of the sheer volume of rain.‚Äù
